definition: see 桀驁不馴|桀骜不驯[jie2 ao4 bu4 xun4]

sentences.english: At that time the scene is no worse than a horror film.
sentences.chinese: 当时的场景丝毫不逊于恐怖电影。

sentences.english: Today before you think of saying an unkind word, Think of someone who can't speak.
sentences.chinese: 如今，在你出言不逊前，想想那些身患哑疾的人吧。

sentences.english: It was rude of a student to sass to the master.
sentences.chinese: 学生对校长出言不逊是粗鲁无礼的。

sentences.english: Western publishers have been no less enthused by China's continued rapid growth.
sentences.chinese: 西方出版商对中国快速经济增长的着迷毫不逊色。

sentences.english: Unleash your own spirit, and you will become the Primal Beast, uncaged and untamed.
sentences.chinese: 释放自己的灵魂，你就会成为桀骜不逊的太初之兽。

sentences.english: In many areas of product quality is not inferior to Hebei Quyang.
sentences.chinese: 许多地区的产品质量不逊于河北曲阳。

sentences.english: the women no less than the men crowd round nudities.
sentences.chinese: 周围的女人们穿着上的裸露相比男人毫不逊色。

sentences.english: Penglai Pavilion should be, of course, no exception.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，这蓬莱阁也毫不逊色。

sentences.english: Big sister listen to nine younger sister linesmen, quickly condemned.
sentences.chinese: 大妹听“九妹”出言不逊，急忙谴责。

sentences.english: We believe our price is competitive enough to induce business.
sentences.chinese: 我们相信我们的价格不逊于别家，是可招来业务的。

sentences.english: You are always abusing and offending people.
sentences.chinese: 你总是出言不逊得罪人。

sentences.english: She burned with fury at his unkind remarks.
sentences.chinese: 她对他的出言不逊怒火中烧。

sentences.english: Sometimes, plan B is pretty good.
sentences.chinese: 有时，备选方案也毫不逊色。

sentences.english: For the first time, psychologists have found that swearing may serve an important function in relieving pain.
sentences.chinese: 这是心理学家们头一次发现出言不逊具有镇痛的功效。

sentences.english: What he said about Tom’s mother was way below the belt.
sentences.chinese: 他对汤姆的妈妈评论的话真的是出言不逊。

definition: lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)
not to be inferior in any aspects (idiom)/to surpass/to outdo/(derog.) to be even worse
pinyin: you3 guo4 zhi1 er2 wu2 bu4 ji2

definition: accurate to perfection (idiom)/precise to the finest detail
inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
as many as/no less than/not inferior to/as good as/on a par with
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3
